file_content.text: I hope you understand the futility of all of this.
You claim the crystals for the Empire. They build their armada. We will find a way to detect it, to destroy it.
And then the Empire will build something bigger and better. On and on and on. Until we destroy each other or the galaxy.
The Republic is weak and afraid. You'll surrender long before the galaxy is destroyed.
I call your bluff.
Might not be a bad idea if you both destroyed each other. More for the rest of us.
Doesn't sound half-bad.
The Empire and the Republic are the galaxy. You'll be caught up in it, too. You already are.
Then it would be best if you surrendered to me now, don't you think?
Are you saying you give up?
What good would that do?
Could there be a more glorious end?
I can't wait.
What's glory when everything is destroyed?
I think the Empire will win long before it comes to that.
That's a little alarmist.
The Republic will never stop opposing you.
Not my problem.
I figured you would say that.
I suppose you think if you just kill me, this will all be over. What did I tell you about destroying great men?
The Empire will fail because it insists on being a set of individuals, rather than a true citizenship. Because it insists on pushing everyone else to the margins.
All this talk isn't doing you any favors.
You're on thin ice. [Arrest Shai]
No? I didn't expect so. Let's get this done with, then.
And the Republic will fail because it insists on being dragged down by the weak.
The Republic isn't perfect.
We pull the weak up, and become stronger as a result.
Failing to understand that will be your downfall.
If I could change the Empire I would, but I won't betray it.
My Empire, right or wrong.
Then I have nothing to say but that I admire you, and wish you the best of luck.
Enough talk. [Attack]
I've heard enough. [Kill Shai]
